BackstoryDef.title: shadow chancellor
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] orchestrated a long political crisis that bankrupted two stellar nations while enriching [PAWN_possessive] secret allies. \nWhen exposed, [PAWN_pronoun] surrendered power dramatically, knowing the ensuing chaos would make [PAWN_objective] indispensable. Now [PAWN_nameDef] whispers counsel to rimworld leaders, [PAWN_possessive] "exile" carefully staged to position [PAWN_objective] as the only solution to crises [PAWN_pronoun] discreetly engineers.

BackstoryDef.title: discipline officer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] enforced the Stellarch's will across imperial legions. [PAWN_pronoun] crushed rebellions through public floggings and ammunition rationing, developing perfect blade control from executing deserters.

BackstoryDef.title: palace groundskeeper
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] maintained ornamental gardens for imperial nobles. [PAWN_pronoun] perfected rose grafting and hedge sculpting, often collaborating with royal architects on greenhouse placements.

BackstoryDef.title: royal guard
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] swore blood oaths to protect the Stellarch's inner chambers. [PAWN_pronoun] trained daily following the royal guard strict regimen, developing the ability to spot menaces not visible to untrained eyes. [PAWN_possessive] vow demands lethal force against any unauthorized approach, even former comrades.

BackstoryDef.title: chamber sentinel
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] protected high-ranking nobles in the imperial court. [PAWN_pronoun] learned to spot concealed weapons during audiences and defuse conflicts with measured words, though [PAWN_pronoun] never touched a tool in [PAWN_possessive] life.

BackstoryDef.title: imperial attache
BackstoryDef.description:
[PAWN_nameDef] worked as an Imperial liaison to frontier protectorates, tasked with monitoring compliance, morale, and subversive activity. This meant pirate groups, minor cults, rogue nobles—typical stuff. But [PAWN_nameDef] had a different theory. 
He blamed the Ancients. For everything. Lost shipments? Ancient sabotage. A psychic wave? Clearly a test pattern. Entire town vanishes overnight? “Vault Awakening Protocol.” 
His superiors ignored the reports—most ending in all-caps with words like “INFILTRATION” or “BIO-ECHO.” Eventually, [PAWN_pronoun] was removed from post and transferred to low-tier auditing duty. [PAWN_pronoun] kept filing incident requests anyway. Hundreds. 
Imperial science bureaus maintain that all vaults are inert and fully monitored, with no signs of disturbance in recorded centuries. 
Last report filed by [PAWN_nameDef]: “Observation Team 9 missing. Vault 7A found open.”

BackstoryDef.title: forgotten vizier
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] rose quickly through the Empire’s Logotheum, showing unblinking insight into bureaucratic systems and psychohistorical modeling. But [PAWN_possessive] mind resonated with psychic currents not desired by the Imperial government. Not desired at all. \n[PAWN_pronoun] was reassigned quietly, shamefully—buried beneath strata of administration. There, they refit [PAWN_objective] for archival labor, threading augmetics through skull and spine, tuning [PAWN_possessive] senses to the crawl of data. [PAWN_pronoun] worked in a records silo below the capital hive, half-aware among machines and motionless archivists. \nOne day, a high clerk requisitioned some personnel batch—a clearance protocol. [PAWN_pronoun] was pulled out, reprocessed, and deployed. No one knew why [PAWN_pronoun] had been down there. Least of all [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: duelist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Though [PAWN_pronoun] wore the signet and sash of Imperial nobility, [PAWN_nameDef] was better known for the duels [PAWN_pronoun] demanded than the duties [PAWN_pronoun] fulfilled. [PAWN_pronoun] fought over matters of honor, heritage, and aesthetics, including fourteen bloodied challenges over which ancient poet deserved the Imperial laurels—Calvian or Metros, both long-dead voices of the Golden Court. \nIn truth, [PAWN_pronoun] had never read a single line from either. [PAWN_possessive] tutors had failed [PAWN_objective], and [PAWN_possessive] pride forbade confession. Yet blade sang where verse failed, and no one questioned the taste of a someone who could kill for it.
